intro: Calamovilfa brevipilis, commonly known as the short-stemmed rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged in dense clusters. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Calamovilfa brevipilis is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
